title: Connie Mack
summary: Cornelius McGillicuddy (December 22, 1862 â€“ February 8, 1956), better known as Connie Mack, was an American professional baseball catcher, manager, and team owner. The longest-serving manager in Major League Baseball history, he holds records for wins (3,731), losses (3,948), and games managed (7,755), with his victory total being almost 1,000 more than any other manager. His loss total is also more than 1,000 than any other manager.
